062/**
063 * Represents an HTTP request for a REST resource.
064 *
065 * <p>
066 *    The {@link RestRequest} object is an extension of the <l>HttpServletRequest</l> class
067 *    with various built-in convenience methods for use in building REST interfaces.
068 *    It can be accessed by passing it as a parameter on your REST Java method:
069 * </p>
070 *
071 * <p class='bjava'>
072 *    <ja>@RestPost</ja>(...)
073 *    <jk>public</jk> Object myMethod(RestRequest <jv>req</jv>) {...}
074 * </p>
075 *
076 * <p>
077 *    The primary methods on this class are:
078 * </p>
079 * <ul class='javatree'>
080 *    <li class='jc'>{@link RestRequest}
081 *    <ul class='spaced-list'>
082 *       <li>Methods for accessing the request content:
083 *       <ul class='javatreec'>
084 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getContent() getContent()}
085 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getInputStream() getInputStream()}
086 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getReader() getReader()}
087 *       </ul>
088 *       <li>Methods for accessing HTTP parts:
089 *       <ul class='javatreec'>
090 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#containsFormParam(String) containsFormParam(String)}
091 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#containsHeader(String) containsHeader(String)}
092 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#containsQueryParam(String) containsQueryParam(String)}
093 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getHeader(Class) getHeader(Class)}
094 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getHeader(String) getHeader(String)}
095 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getHeaders() getHeaders()}
096 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getFormParam(Class) getFormParam(Class)}
097 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getFormParam(String) getFormParam(String)}
098 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getFormParams() getFormParams()}
099 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getPathParam(Class) getPathParam(Class)}
100 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getPathParam(String) getPathParam(String)}
101 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getPathParams() getPathParams()}
102 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getPathRemainder() getPathRemainder()}
103 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getQueryParam(Class) getQueryParam(Class)}
104 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getQueryParam(String) getQueryParam(String)}
105 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getQueryParams() getQueryParams()}
106 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getQueryString() getQueryString()}
107 *       </ul>
108 *       <li>Methods for localization:
109 *       <ul class='javatreec'>
110 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getLocale() getLocale()}
111 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getMessage(String,Object...) getMessage(String,Object...)}
112 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getMessages() getMessages()}
113 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getTimeZone() getTimeZone()}
114 *       </ul>
115 *       <li>Methods for accessing static files:
116 *       <ul class='javatreec'>
117 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getStaticFiles() getStaticFiles()}
118 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getVarResolverSession() getVarResolverSession()}
119 *       </ul>
120 *       <li>Methods for assertions:
121 *       <ul class='javatreec'>
122 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#assertContent() assertContent()}
123 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#assertCharset() assertCharset()}
124 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#assertFormParam(String) assertFormParam(String)}
125 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#assertHeader(String) assertHeader(String)}
126 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#assertQueryParam(String) assertQueryParam(String)}
127 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#assertRequestLine() assertRequestLine()}
128 *       </ul>
129 *       <li>Other:
130 *       <ul class='javatreec'>
131 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getAttribute(String) getAttribute(String)}
132 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getAttributes() getAttributes()}
133 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getAuthorityPath() getAuthorityPath()}
134 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getBeanSession() getBeanSession()}
135 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getCharset() getCharset()}
136 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getConfig() getConfig()}
137 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getContext() getContext()}
138 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getContextPath() getContextPath()}
139 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getHttpServletRequest() getHttpServletRequest()}
140 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getMethod() getMethod()}
141 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getOpContext() getOpContext()}
142 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getOperationSwagger() getOperationSwagger()}
143 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getPartParserSession() getPartParserSession()}
144 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getPartSerializerSession() getPartSerializerSession()}
145 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getPathInfo() getPathInfo()}
146 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getProtocolVersion() getProtocolVersion()}
147 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getRequest(Class) getRequest(Class)}
148 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getRequestLine() getRequestLine()}
149 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getRequestURI() getRequestURI()}
150 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getRequestURL() getRequestURL()}
151 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getServletPath() getServletPath()}
152 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getSession() getSession()}
153 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getSwagger() getSwagger()}
154 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getUriContext() getUriContext()}
155 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getUriResolver() getUriResolver()}
156 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#isDebug() isDebug()}
157 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#isPlainText() isPlainText()}
158 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#isUserInRole(String) isUserInRole(String)}
159 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#setAttribute(String,Object) setAttribute(String,Object)}
160 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#setCharset(Charset) setCharset(Charset)}
161 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#setDebug() setDebug()}
162 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#setException(Throwable) setException(Throwable)}
163 *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#setNoTrace() setNoTrace()}
164 *       </ul>
165 *    </ul>
166 * </ul>
167 *
168 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
169
170 * </ul>
171 */
172@SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "unused" })
173public final class RestRequest extends HttpServletRequestWrapper {
174
175   // Constructor initialized.
176   private HttpServletRequest inner;
177   private final RestContext context;
178   private final RestOpContext opContext;
179   private final RequestContent content;
180   private final BeanSession beanSession;
181   private final RequestQueryParams queryParams;
182   private final RequestPathParams pathParams;
183   private final RequestHeaders headers;
184   private final RequestAttributes attrs;
185   private final HttpPartParserSession partParserSession;
186   private final RestSession session;
187
188   // Lazy initialized.
189   private VarResolverSession varSession;
190   private RequestFormParams formParams;
191   private UriContext uriContext;
192   private String authorityPath;
193   private Config config;
194   private Swagger swagger;
195   private Charset charset;
196
197   /**
198    * Constructor.
199    */
200   RestRequest(RestOpContext opContext, RestSession session) throws Exception {
201      super(session.getRequest());
202      this.session = session;
203      this.opContext = opContext;
204
205      inner = session.getRequest();
206      context = session.getContext();
207
208      attrs = new RequestAttributes(this);
209
210      queryParams = new RequestQueryParams(this, session.getQueryParams(), true);
211
212      headers = new RequestHeaders(this, queryParams, false);
213
214      content = new RequestContent(this);
215
216      if (context.isAllowContentParam()) {
217         String b = queryParams.get("content").asString().orElse(null);
218         if (b != null) {
219            headers.set("Content-Type", UonSerializer.DEFAULT.getResponseContentType());
220            content.mediaType(MediaType.UON).parser(UonParser.DEFAULT).content(b.getBytes(UTF8));
221         }
222      }
223
224      pathParams = new RequestPathParams(session, this, true);
225
226      beanSession = opContext.getBeanContext().getSession();
227
228      partParserSession = opContext.getPartParser().getPartSession();
229
230      pathParams.parser(partParserSession);
231
232      queryParams
233         .addDefault(opContext.getDefaultRequestQueryData().getAll())
234         .parser(partParserSession);
235
236      headers
237         .addDefault(opContext.getDefaultRequestHeaders().getAll())
238         .addDefault(context.getDefaultRequestHeaders().getAll())
239         .parser(partParserSession);
240
241      content
242         .encoders(opContext.getEncoders())
243         .parsers(opContext.getParsers())
244         .maxInput(opContext.getMaxInput());
245
246      attrs
247         .addDefault(opContext.getDefaultRequestAttributes())
248         .addDefault(context.getDefaultRequestAttributes());
249
250      if (isDebug())
251         inner = CachingHttpServletRequest.wrap(inner);
252   }
253
254   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
255   // Request line.
256   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
257
258   /**
259    * Returns the request line of this request.
260    *
261    * @return The request line of this request.
262    */
263   public RequestLine getRequestLine() {
264      String x = inner.getProtocol();
265      int i = x.indexOf('/');
266      int j = x.indexOf('.', i);
267      ProtocolVersion pv = new ProtocolVersion(x.substring(0,i), parseInt(x.substring(i+1,j)), parseInt(x.substring(j+1)));
268      return new BasicRequestLine(inner.getMethod(), inner.getRequestURI(), pv);
269   }
270
271   /**
272    * Returns the protocol version from the request line of this request.
273    *
274    * @return The protocol version from the request line of this request.
275    */
276   public ProtocolVersion getProtocolVersion() {
277      return getRequestLine().getProtocolVersion();
278   }
279
280   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
281   // Assertions
282   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
283
284   /**
285    * Returns an assertion on the request line returned by {@link #getRequestLine()}.
286    *
287    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
288    * <p class='bjava'>
289    *    <jc>// Validates the request content contains "foo".</jc>
290    *    <jv>request</jv>
291    *       .assertRequestLine().protocol().minor().is(1);
292    * </p>
293    *
294    * @return A new assertion object.
295    */
296   public FluentRequestLineAssertion<RestRequest> assertRequestLine() {
297      return new FluentRequestLineAssertion<>(getRequestLine(), this);
298   }
299
300   /**
301    * Returns a fluent assertion for the request content.
302    *
303    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
304    * <p class='bjava'>
305    *    <jc>// Validates the request content contains "foo".</jc>
306    *    <jv>request</jv>
307    *       .assertContent().asString().is(<js>"foo"</js>);
308    * </p>
309    *
310    * @return A new fluent assertion on the content, never <jk>null</jk>.
311    */
312   public FluentRequestContentAssertion<RestRequest> assertContent() {
313      return new FluentRequestContentAssertion<>(getContent(), this);
314   }
315
316   /**
317    * Returns a fluent assertion for the specified header.
318    *
319    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
320    * <p class='bjava'>
321    *    <jc>// Validates the content type is JSON.</jc>
322    *    <jv>request</jv>
323    *       .assertHeader(<js>"Content-Type"</js>).asString().is(<js>"application/json"</js>);
324    * </p>
325    *
326    * @param name The header name.
327    * @return A new fluent assertion on the parameter, never <jk>null</jk>.
328    */
329   public FluentRequestHeaderAssertion<RestRequest> assertHeader(String name) {
330      return new FluentRequestHeaderAssertion<>(getHeaderParam(name), this);
331   }
332
333   /**
334    * Returns a fluent assertion for the specified query parameter.
335    *
336    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
337    * <p class='bjava'>
338    *    <jc>// Validates the content type is JSON.</jc>
339    *    <jv>request</jv>
340    *       .assertQueryParam(<js>"foo"</js>).asString().contains(<js>"bar"</js>);
341    * </p>
342    *
343    * @param name The query parameter name.
344    * @return A new fluent assertion on the parameter, never <jk>null</jk>.
345    */
346   public FluentRequestQueryParamAssertion<RestRequest> assertQueryParam(String name) {
347      return new FluentRequestQueryParamAssertion<>(getQueryParam(name), this);
348   }
349
350
351   /**
352    * Returns a fluent assertion for the specified form parameter.
353    *
354    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
355    * <p class='bjava'>
356    *    <jc>// Validates the content type is JSON.</jc>
357    *    <jv>request</jv>
358    *       .assertFormParam(<js>"foo"</js>).asString().contains(<js>"bar"</js>);
359    * </p>
360    *
361    * @param name The query parameter name.
362    * @return A new fluent assertion on the parameter, never <jk>null</jk>.
363    */
364   public FluentRequestFormParamAssertion<RestRequest> assertFormParam(String name) {
365      return new FluentRequestFormParamAssertion<>(getFormParam(name), this);
366   }
367
368   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
369   // Headers
370   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
371
372   /**
373    * Request headers.
374    *
375    * <p>
376    * Returns a {@link RequestHeaders} object that encapsulates access to HTTP headers on the request.
377    *
378    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
379    * <p class='bjava'>
380    *    <ja>@RestPost</ja>(...)
381    *    <jk>public</jk> Object myMethod(RestRequest <jv>req</jv>) {
382    *
383    *       <jc>// Get access to headers.</jc>
384    *       RequestHeaders <jv>headers</jv> = <jv>req</jv>.getRequestHeaders();
385    *
386    *       <jc>// Add a default value.</jc>
387    *       <jv>headers</jv>.addDefault(<js>"ETag"</js>, <jsf>DEFAULT_UUID</jsf>);
388    *
389    *    <jc>// Get a header value as a POJO.</jc>
390    *       UUID etag = <jv>headers</jv>.get(<js>"ETag"</js>).as(UUID.<jk>class</jk>).orElse(<jk>null</jk>);
391    *
392    *       <jc>// Get a standard header.</jc>
393    *       Optional&lt;CacheControl&gt; = <jv>headers</jv>.getCacheControl();
394    *    }
395    * </p>
396    *
397    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
398    *    <li class='note'>
399    *       This object is modifiable.
400    *    <li class='note'>
401    *       Values are converted from strings using the registered part parser on the resource class.
402    *    <li class='note'>
403    *       The {@link RequestHeaders} object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
404    *    <li class='note'>
405    *       The {@link Header @Header} annotation can be used to access individual header values.
406    * </ul>
407    *
408    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
409    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../index.html#jrs.HttpParts">HTTP Parts</a>
410    * </ul>
411    *
412    * @return
413    *    The headers on this request.
414    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
415    */
416   public RequestHeaders getHeaders() {
417      return headers;
418   }
419
420   /**
421    * Returns the last header with a specified name of this message.
422    *
423    * <p>
424    * If there is more than one matching header in the message the last element of <c>getHeaders(String)</c> is returned.
425    * <br>If there is no matching header in the message, an empty request header object is returned.
426    *
427    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
428    * <p class='bjava'>
429    *    <jc>// Gets a header and throws a BadRequest if it doesn't exist.</jc>
430    *    <jv>request</jv>
431    *       .getHeader(<js>"Foo"</js>)
432    *       .assertValue().exists()
433    *       .get();
434    * </p>
435    *
436    * @param name The header name.
437    * @return The request header object, never <jk>null</jk>.
438    */
439   public RequestHeader getHeaderParam(String name) {
440      return headers.getLast(name);
441   }
442
443   /**
444    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this request contains the specified header.
445    *
446    * @param name The header name.
447    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this request contains the specified header.
448    */
449   public boolean containsHeader(String name) {
450      return headers.contains(name);
451   }
452
453   /**
454    * Provides the ability to perform fluent-style assertions on the response character encoding.
455    *
456    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
457    * <p class='bjava'>
458    *    <jc>// Validates that the response content charset is UTF-8.</jc>
459    *    <jv>request</jv>
460    *       .assertCharset().is(<js>"utf-8"</js>);
461    * </p>
462    *
463    * @return A new fluent assertion object.
464    * @throws BasicHttpException If REST call failed.
465    */
466   public FluentStringAssertion<RestRequest> assertCharset() {
467      return new FluentStringAssertion<>(getCharset().name(), this);
468   }
469
470   /**
471    * Sets the charset to expect on the request content.
472    *
473    * @param value The new value to use for the request content.
474    */
475   public void setCharset(Charset value) {
476      this.charset = value;
477   }
478
479   /**
480    * Returns the charset specified on the <c>Content-Type</c> header, or <js>"UTF-8"</js> if not specified.
481    *
482    * @return The charset to use to decode the request content.
483    */
484   public Charset getCharset() {
485      if (charset == null) {
486         // Determine charset
487         // NOTE:  Don't use super.getCharacterEncoding() because the spec is implemented inconsistently.
488         // Jetty returns the default charset instead of null if the character is not specified on the request.
489         String h = getHeaderParam("Content-Type").orElse(null);
490         if (h != null) {
491            int i = h.indexOf(";charset=");
492            if (i > 0)
493               charset = Charset.forName(h.substring(i+9).trim());
494         }
495         if (charset == null)
496            charset = opContext.getDefaultCharset();
497         if (charset == null)
498            charset = Charset.forName("UTF-8");
499      }
500      return charset;
501   }
502
503   /**
504    * Returns the preferred Locale that the client will accept content in, based on the Accept-Language header.
505    *
506    * <p>
507    * If the client request doesn't provide an <c>Accept-Language</c> header, this method returns the default locale for the server.
508    *
509    * @return The preferred Locale that the client will accept content in.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
510    */
511   @Override
512   public Locale getLocale() {
513      Locale best = inner.getLocale();
514      String h = headers.get("Accept-Language").asString().orElse(null);
515      if (h != null) {
516         StringRanges sr = StringRanges.of(h);
517         float qValue = 0;
518         for (StringRange r : sr.toList()) {
519            if (r.getQValue() > qValue) {
520               best = toLocale(r.getName());
521               qValue = r.getQValue();
522            }
523         }
524      }
525      return best;
526   }
527
528   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
529   // Standard headers.
530   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
531
532   /**
533    * Returns the request header of the specified type.
534    *
535    * <p>
536    * Type must have a name specified via the {@link org.apache.juneau.http.annotation.Header} annotation
537    * and a public constructor that takes in either <c>value</c> or <c>name,value</c> as strings.
538    *
539    * <p>
540    * Typically any of the following:
541    * <ul class='javatreec'>
542    *    <li class='jc'>{@link Accept}
543    *    <li class='jc'>{@link AcceptCharset}
544    *    <li class='jc'>{@link AcceptEncoding}
545    *    <li class='jc'>{@link AcceptLanguage}
546    *    <li class='jc'>{@link AcceptRanges}
547    *    <li class='jc'>{@link Authorization}
548    *    <li class='jc'>{@link CacheControl}
549    *    <li class='jc'>{@link ClientVersion}
550    *    <li class='jc'>{@link Connection}
551    *    <li class='jc'>{@link ContentDisposition}
552    *    <li class='jc'>{@link ContentEncoding}
553    *    <li class='jc'>{@link ContentLength}
554    *    <li class='jc'>{@link ContentType}
555    *    <li class='jc'>{@link Date}
556    *    <li class='jc'>{@link Debug}
557    *    <li class='jc'>{@link Expect}
558    *    <li class='jc'>{@link Forwarded}
559    *    <li class='jc'>{@link From}
560    *    <li class='jc'>{@link Host}
561    *    <li class='jc'>{@link IfMatch}
562    *    <li class='jc'>{@link IfModifiedSince}
563    *    <li class='jc'>{@link IfNoneMatch}
564    *    <li class='jc'>{@link IfRange}
565    *    <li class='jc'>{@link IfUnmodifiedSince}
566    *    <li class='jc'>{@link MaxForwards}
567    *    <li class='jc'>{@link NoTrace}
568    *    <li class='jc'>{@link Origin}
569    *    <li class='jc'>{@link Pragma}
570    *    <li class='jc'>{@link ProxyAuthorization}
571    *    <li class='jc'>{@link Range}
572    *    <li class='jc'>{@link Referer}
573    *    <li class='jc'>{@link TE}
574    *    <li class='jc'>{@link Thrown}
575    *    <li class='jc'>{@link Upgrade}
576    *    <li class='jc'>{@link UserAgent}
577    *    <li class='jc'>{@link Warning}
578    * </ul>
579    *
580    * @param <T> The bean type to create.
581    * @param type The bean type to create.
582    * @return The parsed header on the request, never <jk>null</jk>.
583    */
584   public <T> Optional<T> getHeader(Class<T> type) {
585      return headers.get(type);
586   }
587
588   /**
589    * Returns the <c>Time-Zone</c> header value on the request if there is one.
590    *
591    * <p>
592    * Example: <js>"GMT"</js>.
593    *
594    * @return The parsed header on the request, never <jk>null</jk>.
595    */
596   public Optional<TimeZone> getTimeZone() {
597      String tz = headers.get("Time-Zone").asString().orElse(null);
598      if (tz != null)
599         return Utils.opt(TimeZone.getTimeZone(tz));
600      return Optional.empty();
601   }
602
603   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
604   // Attributes
605   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
606
607   /**
608    * Request attributes.
609    *
610    * <p>
611    * Returns a {@link RequestAttributes} object that encapsulates access to attributes on the request.
612    *
613    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
614    * <p class='bjava'>
615    *    <ja>@RestPost</ja>(...)
616    *    <jk>public</jk> Object myMethod(RestRequest <jv>req</jv>) {
617    *
618    *       <jc>// Get access to attributes.</jc>
619    *       RequestAttributes <jv>attributes</jv> = <jv>req</jv>.getAttributes();
620    *
621    *    <jc>// Get a header value as a POJO.</jc>
622    *       UUID <jv>etag</jv> = <jv>attributes</jv>.get(<js>"ETag"</js>, UUID.<jk>class</jk>);
623    *    }
624    * </p>
625    *
626    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
627    *    <li class='note'>
628    *       This object is modifiable.
629    *    <li class='note'>
630    *       Values are converted from strings using the registered part parser on the resource class.
631    *    <li class='note'>
632    *       The {@link RequestAttributes} object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
633    *    <li class='note'>
634    *       The {@link Attr @Attr} annotation can be used to access individual attribute values.
635    * </ul>
636    *
637    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
638    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../index.html#jrs.HttpParts">HTTP Parts</a>
639    * </ul>
640    *
641    * @return
642    *    The headers on this request.
643    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
644    */
645   public RequestAttributes getAttributes() {
646      return attrs;
647   }
648
649   /**
650    * Returns the request attribute with the specified name.
651    *
652    * @param name The attribute name.
653    * @return The attribute value, never <jk>null</jk>.
654    */
655   @Override
656   public RequestAttribute getAttribute(String name) {
657      return attrs.get(name);
658   }
659
660   /**
661    * Sets a request attribute.
662    *
663    * @param name The attribute name.
664    * @param value The attribute value.
665    */
666   @Override
667   public void setAttribute(String name, Object value) {
668      attrs.set(name, value);
669   }
670
671   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
672   // Query parameters
673   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
674
675   /**
676    * Query parameters.
677    *
678    * <p>
679    * Returns a {@link RequestQueryParams} object that encapsulates access to URL GET parameters.
680    *
681    * <p>
682    * Similar to {@link HttpServletRequest#getParameterMap()} but only looks for query parameters in the URL and not form posts.
683    *
684    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
685    * <p class='bjava'>
686    *    <ja>@RestGet</ja>(...)
687    *    <jk>public void</jk> doGet(RestRequest <jv>req</jv>) {
688    *
689    *       <jc>// Get access to query parameters on the URL.</jc>
690    *       RequestQueryParams <jv>query</jv> = <jv>req</jv>.getQuery();
691    *
692    *       <jc>// Get query parameters converted to various types.</jc>
693    *       <jk>int</jk> <jv>p1/</jv> = <jv>query</jv>.getInteger(<js>"p1"</js>).orElse(<jk>null</jk>);
694    *       String <jv>p2</jv> = <jv>query</jv>.getString(<js>"p2"</js>).orElse(<jk>null</jk>);
695    *       UUID <jv>p3</jv> = <jv>query</jv>.get(<js>"p3"</js>).as(UUID.<jk>class</jk>).orElse(<jk>null</jk>);
696    *    }
697    * </p>
698    *
699    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
700    *    <li class='note'>
701    *       This object is modifiable.
702    * </ul>
703    *
704    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
705    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../index.html#jrs.HttpParts">HTTP Parts</a>
706    * </ul>
707    *
708    * @return
709    *    The query parameters as a modifiable map.
710    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
711    */
712   public RequestQueryParams getQueryParams() {
713      return queryParams;
714   }
715
716   /**
717    * Shortcut for calling <c>getRequestQuery().getLast(<jv>name</jv>)</c>.
718    *
719    * @param name The query parameter name.
720    * @return The query parameter, never <jk>null</jk>.
721    */
722   public RequestQueryParam getQueryParam(String name) {
723      return queryParams.get(name);
724   }
725
726   /**
727    * Returns the request query parameter of the specified type.
728    *
729    * <p>
730    * Type must have a name specified via the {@link org.apache.juneau.http.annotation.Query} annotation
731    * and a public constructor that takes in either <c>value</c> or <c>name,value</c> as strings.
732    *
733    * @param <T> The bean type to create.
734    * @param type The bean type to create.
735    * @return The parsed query parameter on the request, never <jk>null</jk>.
736    */
737   public <T> Optional<T> getQueryParam(Class<T> type) {
738      return queryParams.get(type);
739   }
740
741   /**
742    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this request contains the specified header.
743    *
744    * @param name The header name.
745    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this request contains the specified header.
746    */
747   public boolean containsQueryParam(String name) {
748      return queryParams.contains(name);
749   }
750
751
752   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
753   // Form data parameters
754   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
755
756   /**
757    * Form-data.
758    *
759    * <p>
760    * Returns a {@link RequestFormParams} object that encapsulates access to form post parameters.
761    *
762    * <p>
763    * Similar to {@link HttpServletRequest#getParameterMap()}, but only looks for form data in the HTTP content.
764    *
765    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
766    * <p class='bjava'>
767    *    <ja>@RestPost</ja>(...)
768    *    <jk>public void</jk> doPost(RestRequest <jv>req</jv>) {
769    *
770    *       <jc>// Get access to parsed form data parameters.</jc>
771    *       RequestFormParams <jv>formParams</jv> = <jv>req</jv>.getFormParams();
772    *
773    *       <jc>// Get form data parameters converted to various types.</jc>
774    *       <jk>int</jk> <jv>p1</jv> = <jv>formParams</jv>.get(<js>"p1"</js>).asInteger().orElse(0);
775    *       String <jv>p2</jv> = <jv>formParams</jv>.get(<js>"p2"</js>).asString().orElse(<jk>null</jk>);
776    *       UUID <jv>p3</jv> = <jv>formParams</jv>.get(<js>"p3"</js>).as(UUID.<jk>class</jk>).orElse(<jk>null</jk>);
777    *    }
778    * </p>
779    *
780    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
781    *    <li class='note'>
782    *       This object is modifiable.
783    *    <li class='note'>
784    *       Values are converted from strings using the registered part parser on the resource class.
785    *    <li class='note'>
786    *       The {@link RequestFormParams} object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
787    *    <li class='note'>
788    *       The {@link FormData @FormDAta} annotation can be used to access individual form data parameter values.
789    * </ul>
790    *
791    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
792    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../index.html#jrs.HttpParts">HTTP Parts</a>
793    * </ul>
794    *
795    * @return
796    *    The URL-encoded form data from the request.
797    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
798    * @throws InternalServerError If query parameters could not be parsed.
799    * @see org.apache.juneau.http.annotation.FormData
800    */
801   public RequestFormParams getFormParams() throws InternalServerError {
802      try {
803         if (formParams == null)
804            formParams = new RequestFormParams(this, true).parser(partParserSession);
805         formParams.addDefault(opContext.getDefaultRequestFormData().getAll());
806         return formParams;
807      } catch (Exception e) {
808         throw new InternalServerError(e);
809      }
810   }
811
812   /**
813    * Shortcut for calling <c>getFormData().getString(name)</c>.
814    *
815    * @param name The form data parameter name.
816    * @return The form data parameter value, or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
817    */
818   public RequestFormParam getFormParam(String name) {
819      return getFormParams().get(name);
820   }
821
822   /**
823    * Returns the request form-data parameter of the specified type.
824    *
825    * <p>
826    * Type must have a name specified via the {@link org.apache.juneau.http.annotation.FormData} annotation
827    * and a public constructor that takes in either <c>value</c> or <c>name,value</c> as strings.
828    *
829    * @param <T> The bean type to create.
830    * @param type The bean type to create.
831    * @return The parsed form-data parameter on the request, never <jk>null</jk>.
832    */
833   public <T> Optional<T> getFormParam(Class<T> type) {
834      return getFormParams().get(type);
835   }
836
837   /**
838    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this request contains the specified header.
839    *
840    * @param name The header name.
841    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this request contains the specified header.
842    */
843   public boolean containsFormParam(String name) {
844      return getFormParams().contains(name);
845   }
846
847   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
848   // Path parameters
849   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
850
851   /**
852    * Path parameters.
853    *
854    * <p>
855    * Returns a {@link RequestPathParams} object that encapsulates access to URL path parameters.
856    *
857    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
858    * <p class='bjava'>
859    *    <ja>@RestGet</ja>(<js>"/{foo}/{bar}/{baz}/*"</js>)
860    *    <jk>public void</jk> doGet(RestRequest <jv>req</jv>) {
861    *
862    *       <jc>// Get access to path data.</jc>
863    *       RequestPathParams <jv>pathParams</jv> = <jv>req</jv>.getPathParams();
864    *
865    *       <jc>// Example URL:  /123/qux/true/quux</jc>
866    *
867    *       <jk>int</jk> <jv>foo</jv> = <jv>pathParams</jv>.get(<js>"foo"</js>).asInteger().orElse(-1);  <jc>// =123</jc>
868    *       String <jv>bar</jv> = <jv>pathParams</jv>.get(<js>"bar"</js>).orElse(<jk>null</jk>);  <jc>// =qux</jc>
869    *       <jk>boolean</jk> <jv>baz</jv> = <jv>pathParams</jv>.get(<js>"baz"</js>).asBoolean().orElse(<jk>false</jk>);  <jc>// =true</jc>
870    *       String <jv>remainder</jv> = <jv>pathParams</jv>.getRemainder().orElse(<jk>null</jk>);  <jc>// =quux</jc>
871    *    }
872    * </p>
873    *
874    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
875    *    <li class='note'>
876    *       This object is modifiable.
877    * </ul>
878    *
879    * @return
880    *    The path parameters.
881    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
882    */
883   public RequestPathParams getPathParams() {
884      return pathParams;
885   }
886
887   /**
888    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPathParams().get(<jv>name</jv>)</c>.
889    *
890    * @param name The path parameter name.
891    * @return The path parameter, never <jk>null</jk>.
892    */
893   public RequestPathParam getPathParam(String name) {
894      return pathParams.get(name);
895   }
896
897   /**
898    * Returns the request path parameter of the specified type.
899    *
900    * <p>
901    * Type must have a name specified via the {@link org.apache.juneau.http.annotation.Path} annotation
902    * and a public constructor that takes in either <c>value</c> or <c>name,value</c> as strings.
903    *
904    * @param <T> The bean type to create.
905    * @param type The bean type to create.
906    * @return The parsed form-data parameter on the request, never <jk>null</jk>.
907    */
908   public <T> Optional<T> getPathParam(Class<T> type) {
909      return pathParams.get(type);
910   }
911
912   /**
913    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPathParams().getRemainder()</c>.
914    *
915    * @return The path remainder value, never <jk>null</jk>.
916    */
917   public RequestPathParam getPathRemainder() {
918      return pathParams.getRemainder();
919   }

921   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
922   // Content methods
923   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
924
925   /**
926    * Request content.
927    *
928    * <p>
929    * Returns a {@link RequestContent} object that encapsulates access to the HTTP request content.
930    *
931    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
932    * <p class='bjava'>
933    *    <ja>@RestPost</ja>(...)
934    *    <jk>public void</jk> doPost(RestRequest <jv>req</jv>) {
935    *
936    *       <jc>// Convert content to a linked list of Person objects.</jc>
937    *       List&lt;Person&gt; <jv>list</jv> = <jv>req</jv>.getContent().as(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, Person.<jk>class</jk>);
938    *       ..
939    *    }
940    * </p>
941    *
942    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
943    *    <li class='note'>
944    *       The {@link RequestContent} object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
945    *    <li class='note'>
946    *       The {@link Content @Content} annotation can be used to access the content as well.
947    * </ul>
948    *
949    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
950    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../index.html#jrs.HttpParts">HTTP Parts</a>
951    * </ul>
952    *
953    * @return
954    *    The content of this HTTP request.
955    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
956    */
957   public RequestContent getContent() {
958      return content;
959   }
960
961   /**
962    * Returns the HTTP content content as a {@link Reader}.
963    *
964    * <p>
965    * If {@code allowHeaderParams} init parameter is true, then first looks for {@code &content=xxx} in the URL query
966    * string.
967    *
968    * <p>
969    * Automatically handles GZipped input streams.
970    *
971    * <p>
972    * This method is equivalent to calling <c>getContent().getReader()</c>.
973    *
974    * @return The HTTP content content as a {@link Reader}.
975    * @throws IOException If content could not be read.
976    */
977   @Override
978   public BufferedReader getReader() throws IOException {
979      return getContent().getReader();
980   }
981
982   /**
983    * Returns the HTTP content content as an {@link InputStream}.
984    *
985    * <p>
986    * Automatically handles GZipped input streams.
987    *
988    * <p>
989    * This method is equivalent to calling <c>getContent().getInputStream()</c>.
990    *
991    * @return The negotiated input stream.
992    * @throws IOException If any error occurred while trying to get the input stream or wrap it in the GZIP wrapper.
993    */
994   @Override
995   public ServletInputStream getInputStream() throws IOException {
996      return getContent().getInputStream();
997   }
998
999   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1000   // URI-related methods
1001   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1002
1003   /**
1004    * Returns the portion of the request URI that indicates the context of the request.
1005    *
1006    * <p>The context path always comes first in a request URI.
1007    * The path starts with a <js>"/"</js> character but does not end with a <js>"/"</js> character.
1008    * For servlets in the default (root) context, this method returns <js>""</js>.
1009    * The container does not decode this string.
1010    *
1011    * @return The context path, never <jk>null</jk>.
1012    * @see HttpServletRequest#getContextPath()
1013    */
1014   @Override
1015   public String getContextPath() {
1016      String cp = context.getUriContext();
1017      return cp == null ? inner.getContextPath() : cp;
1018   }
1019
1020   /**
1021    * Returns the URI authority portion of the request.
1022    *
1023    * @return The URI authority portion of the request.
1024    */
1025   public String getAuthorityPath() {
1026      if (authorityPath == null)
1027         authorityPath = context.getUriAuthority();
1028      if (authorityPath == null) {
1029         String scheme = inner.getScheme();
1030         int port = inner.getServerPort();
1031         StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(inner.getScheme()).append("://").append(inner.getServerName());
1032         if (! (port == 80 && "http".equals(scheme) || port == 443 && "https".equals(scheme)))
1033            sb.append(':').append(port);
1034         authorityPath = sb.toString();
1035      }
1036      return authorityPath;
1037   }
1038
1039   /**
1040    * Returns the part of this request's URL that calls the servlet.
1041    *
1042    * <p>
1043    * This path starts with a <js>"/"</js> character and includes either the servlet name or a path to the servlet,
1044    * but does not include any extra path information or a query string.
1045    *
1046    * @return The servlet path, never <jk>null</jk>.
1047    * @see HttpServletRequest#getServletPath()
1048    */
1049   @Override
1050   public String getServletPath() {
1051      String cp = context.getUriContext();
1052      String sp = inner.getServletPath();
1053      return cp == null || ! sp.startsWith(cp) ? sp : sp.substring(cp.length());
1054   }
1055
1056   /**
1057    * Returns the URI context of the request.
1058    *
1059    * <p>
1060    * The URI context contains all the information about the URI of the request, such as the servlet URI, context
1061    * path, etc...
1062    *
1063    * @return The URI context of the request.
1064    */
1065   public UriContext getUriContext() {
1066      if (uriContext == null)
1067         uriContext = UriContext.of(getAuthorityPath(), getContextPath(), getServletPath(), StringUtils.urlEncodePath(inner.getPathInfo()));
1068      return uriContext;
1069   }
1070
1071   /**
1072    * Returns a URI resolver that can be used to convert URIs to absolute or root-relative form.
1073    *
1074    * @param resolution The URI resolution rule.
1075    * @param relativity The relative URI relativity rule.
1076    * @return The URI resolver for this request.
1077    */
1078   public UriResolver getUriResolver(UriResolution resolution, UriRelativity relativity) {
1079      return UriResolver.of(resolution, relativity, getUriContext());
1080   }
1081
1082   /**
1083    * Shortcut for calling {@link #getUriResolver()} using {@link UriResolution#ROOT_RELATIVE} and
1084    * {@link UriRelativity#RESOURCE}
1085    *
1086    * @return The URI resolver for this request.
1087    */
1088   public UriResolver getUriResolver() {
1089      return UriResolver.of(context.getUriResolution(), context.getUriRelativity(), getUriContext());
1090   }
1091
1092   /**
1093    * Returns the URI for this request.
1094    *
1095    * <p>
1096    * Similar to {@link #getRequestURI()} but returns the value as a {@link URI}.
1097    * It also gives you the capability to override the query parameters (e.g. add new query parameters to the existing
1098    * URI).
1099    *
1100    * @param includeQuery If <jk>true</jk> include the query parameters on the request.
1101    * @param addQueryParams Augment the request URI with the specified query parameters.
1102    * @return A new URI.
1103    */
1104   public URI getUri(boolean includeQuery, Map<String,Object> addQueryParams) {
1105      String uri = inner.getRequestURI();
1106      if (includeQuery || addQueryParams != null) {
1107         StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(uri);
1108         RequestQueryParams rq = this.queryParams.copy();
1109         if (addQueryParams != null)
1110            for (Map.Entry<String,?> e : addQueryParams.entrySet())
1111               rq.set(e.getKey(), e.getValue());
1112         if (! rq.isEmpty())
1113            sb.append('?').append(rq.asQueryString());
1114         uri = sb.toString();
1115      }
1116      try {
1117         return new URI(uri);
1118      } catch (URISyntaxException e) {
1119         // Shouldn't happen.
1120         throw asRuntimeException(e);
1121      }
1122   }
1123
1124   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1125   // Labels
1126   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1127
1128   /**
1129    * Returns the localized swagger associated with the resource.
1130    *
1131    * <p>
1132    * A shortcut for calling <c>getInfoProvider().getSwagger(request);</c>
1133    *
1134    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1135    * <p class='bjava'>
1136    *    <ja>@RestGet</ja>
1137    *    <jk>public</jk> List&lt;Tag&gt; swaggerTags(RestRequest <jv>req</jv>) {
1138    *       <jk>return</jk> <jv>req</jv>.getSwagger().getTags();
1139    *    }
1140    * </p>
1141    *
1142    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1143    *    <li class='note'>
1144    *       The {@link Swagger} object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
1145    * </ul>
1146    *
1147    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1148    *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestContext.Builder#swaggerProvider(Class)}
1149    *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestContext.Builder#swaggerProvider(SwaggerProvider)}
1150    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../index.html#jrs.Swagger">Swagger</a>
1151    * </ul>
1152    *
1153    * @return
1154    *    The swagger associated with the resource.
1155    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
1156    */
1157   public Optional<Swagger> getSwagger() {
1158      return context.getSwagger(getLocale());
1159   }
1160
1161   /**
1162    * Returns the swagger for the Java method invoked.
1163    *
1164    * @return The swagger for the Java method as an {@link Optional}.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1165    */
1166   public Optional<Operation> getOperationSwagger() {
1167
1168      Optional<Swagger> swagger = getSwagger();
1169      if (! swagger.isPresent())
1170         return Optional.empty();
1171
1172      return ofNullable(swagger.get().getOperation(opContext.getPathPattern(), getMethod().toLowerCase()));
1173   }
1174
1175   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1176   // Other methods
1177   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1178
1179   /**
1180    * Returns the part serializer associated with this request.
1181    *
1182    * @return The part serializer associated with this request.
1183    */
1184   public HttpPartParserSession getPartParserSession() {
1185      return partParserSession;
1186   }
1187
1188   /**
1189    * Returns the HTTP method of this request.
1190    *
1191    * <p>
1192    * If <c>allowHeaderParams</c> init parameter is <jk>true</jk>, then first looks for
1193    * <c>&amp;method=xxx</c> in the URL query string.
1194    *
1195    * @return The HTTP method of this request.
1196    */
1197   @Override
1198   public String getMethod() {
1199      return session.getMethod();
1200   }
1201
1202   /**
1203    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if <c>&amp;plainText=true</c> was specified as a URL parameter.
1204    *
1205    * <p>
1206    * This indicates that the <c>Content-Type</c> of the output should always be set to <js>"text/plain"</js>
1207    * to make it easy to render in a browser.
1208    *
1209    * <p>
1210    * This feature is useful for debugging.
1211    *
1212    * @return <jk>true</jk> if {@code &amp;plainText=true} was specified as a URL parameter
1213    */
1214   public boolean isPlainText() {
1215      return "true".equals(queryParams.get("plainText").asString().orElse("false"));
1216   }
1217
1218   /**
1219    * Returns the resource bundle for the request locale.
1220    *
1221    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1222    * <p class='bjava'>
1223    *    <ja>@RestGet</ja>
1224    *    <jk>public</jk> String hello(RestRequest <jv>req</jv>, <ja>@Query</ja>(<js>"user"</js>) String <jv>user</jv>) {
1225    *
1226    *       <jc>// Return a localized message.</jc>
1227    *       <jk>return</jk> <jv>req</jv>.getMessages().getString(<js>"hello.message"</js>, <jv>user</jv>);
1228    *    }
1229    * </p>
1230    *
1231    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1232    *    <li class='note'>
1233    *       The {@link Messages} object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
1234    * </ul>
1235    *
1236    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1237    *    <li class='jm'>{@link org.apache.juneau.rest.RestRequest#getMessage(String,Object...)}
1238    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../index.html#jrs.LocalizedMessages">Localized Messages</a>
1239    * </ul>
1240    *
1241    * @return
1242    *    The resource bundle.
1243    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
1244    */
1245   public Messages getMessages() {
1246      return context.getMessages().forLocale(getLocale());
1247   }
1248
1249   /**
1250    * Shortcut method for calling {@link RestRequest#getMessages()} and {@link Messages#getString(String,Object...)}.
1251    *
1252    * @param key The message key.
1253    * @param args Optional {@link MessageFormat}-style arguments.
1254    * @return The localized message.
1255    */
1256   public String getMessage(String key, Object...args) {
1257      return getMessages().getString(key, args);
1258   }

1260   /**
1261    * Returns the resource context handling the request.
1262    *
1263    * <p>
1264    * Can be used to access servlet-init parameters or annotations during requests, such as in calls to
1265    * {@link RestGuard#guard(RestRequest, RestResponse)}..
1266    *
1267    * @return The resource context handling the request.
1268    */
1269   public RestContext getContext() {
1270      return context;
1271   }
1272
1273   /**
1274    * Returns access to the inner {@link RestOpContext} of this method.
1275    *
1276    * @return The {@link RestOpContext} of this method.  May be <jk>null</jk> if method has not yet been found.
1277    */
1278   public RestOpContext getOpContext() {
1279      return opContext;
1280   }

1282   /**
1283    * Returns the {@link BeanSession} associated with this request.
1284    *
1285    * @return The request bean session.
1286    */
1287   public BeanSession getBeanSession() {
1288      return beanSession;
1289   }
1290
1291   /**
1292    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if debug mode is enabled.
1293    *
1294    * Debug mode is enabled by simply adding <js>"?debug=true"</js> to the query string or adding a <c>Debug: true</c> header on the request.
1295    *
1296    * @return <jk>true</jk> if debug mode is enabled.
1297    */
1298   public boolean isDebug() {
1299      return getAttribute("Debug").as(Boolean.class).orElse(false);
1300   }
1301
1302   /**
1303    * Sets the <js>"Exception"</js> attribute to the specified throwable.
1304    *
1305    * <p>
1306    * This exception is used by {@link CallLogger} for logging purposes.
1307    *
1308    * @param t The attribute value.
1309    * @return This object.
1310    */
1311   public RestRequest setException(Throwable t) {
1312      setAttribute("Exception", t);
1313      return this;
1314   }
1315
1316   /**
1317    * Sets the <js>"NoTrace"</js> attribute to the specified boolean.
1318    *
1319    * <p>
1320    * This flag is used by {@link CallLogger} and tells it not to log the current request.
1321    *
1322    * @param b The attribute value.
1323    * @return This object.
1324    */
1325   public RestRequest setNoTrace(Boolean b) {
1326      setAttribute("NoTrace", b);
1327      return this;
1328   }
1329
1330   /**
1331    * Shortcut for calling <c>setNoTrace(<jk>true</jk>)</c>.
1332    *
1333    * @return This object.
1334    */
1335   public RestRequest setNoTrace() {
1336      return setNoTrace(true);
1337   }
1338
1339   /**
1340    * Sets the <js>"Debug"</js> attribute to the specified boolean.
1341    *
1342    * <p>
1343    * This flag is used by {@link CallLogger} to help determine how a request should be logged.
1344    *
1345    * @param b The attribute value.
1346    * @return This object.
1347    * @throws IOException If content could not be cached.
1348    */
1349   public RestRequest setDebug(Boolean b) throws IOException {
1350      setAttribute("Debug", b);
1351      if (b)
1352         inner = CachingHttpServletRequest.wrap(inner);
1353      return this;
1354   }
1355
1356   /**
1357    * Shortcut for calling <c>setDebug(<jk>true</jk>)</c>.
1358    *
1359    * @return This object.
1360    * @throws IOException If content could not be cached.
1361    */
1362   public RestRequest setDebug() throws IOException {
1363      return setDebug(true);
1364   }
1365
1366   /**
1367    * Request-level variable resolver session.
1368    *
1369    * <p>
1370    * Used to resolve SVL variables in text.
1371    *
1372    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1373    * <p class='bjava'>
1374    *    <ja>@RestGet</ja>
1375    *    <jk>public</jk> String hello(RestRequest <jv>req</jv>) {
1376    *
1377    *       <jc>// Get var resolver session.</jc>
1378    *       VarResolverSession <jv>session</jv> = getVarResolverSession();
1379    *
1380    *       <jc>// Use it to construct a customized message from a query parameter.</jc>
1381    *       <jk>return</jk> <jv>session</jv>.resolve(<js>"Hello $RQ{user}!"</js>);
1382    *    }
1383    * </p>
1384    *
1385    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1386    *    <li class='note'>
1387    *       The {@link VarResolverSession} object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
1388    * </ul>
1389    *
1390    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1391    *    <li class='jm'>{@link org.apache.juneau.rest.RestContext#getVarResolver()}
1392    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../index.html#jrs.SvlVariables">SVL Variables</a>
1393    * </ul>
1394    *
1395    * @return The variable resolver for this request.
1396    */
1397   public VarResolverSession getVarResolverSession() {
1398      if (varSession == null)
1399         varSession = context
1400            .getVarResolver()
1401            .createSession(session.getBeanStore())
1402            .bean(RestRequest.class, this)
1403            .bean(RestSession.class, session);
1404      return varSession;
1405   }
1406
1407   /**
1408    * Returns the static files registered on the REST resource context object.
1409    *
1410    * <p>
1411    * Used to retrieve localized files to be served up as static files through the REST API.
1412    *
1413    * @return This object.
1414    */
1415   public StaticFiles getStaticFiles() {
1416      return context.getStaticFiles();
1417   }
1418
1419   /**
1420    * Config file associated with the resource.
1421    *
1422    * <p>
1423    * Returns a config file with session-level variable resolution.
1424    *
1425    * The config file is identified via one of the following:
1426    * <ul class='javatree'>
1427    *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#config()}
1428    *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestContext.Builder#config(Config)}
1429    * </ul>
1430    *
1431    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1432    * <p class='bjava'>
1433    *    <ja>@RestGet</ja>(...)
1434    *    <jk>public void</jk> doGet(RestRequest <jv>req</jv>) {
1435    *
1436    *       <jc>// Get config file.</jc>
1437    *       Config <jv>config</jv> = <jv>req</jv>.getConfig();
1438    *
1439    *       <jc>// Get simple values from config file.</jc>
1440    *       <jk>int</jk> <jv>timeout</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MyResource/timeout"</js>).asInteger().orElse(=10000);
1441    *
1442    *       <jc>// Get complex values from config file.</jc>
1443    *       MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MyResource/myBean"</js>).as(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>).orElse(<jk>null</jk>);
1444    *    }
1445    * </p>
1446    *
1447    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1448    *    <li class='note'>
1449    *       The {@link Config} object can also be passed as a parameter on the method.
1450    * </ul>
1451    *
1452    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1453    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../index.html#jrs.ConfigurationFiles">Configuration Files</a>
1454    * </ul>
1455    *
1456    * @return
1457    *    The config file associated with the resource, or <jk>null</jk> if resource does not have a config file
1458    *    associated with it.
1459    */
1460   public Config getConfig() {
1461      if (config == null)
1462         config = context.getConfig().resolving(getVarResolverSession());
1463      return config;
1464   }
1465
1466   /**
1467    * Creates a proxy interface to retrieve HTTP parts of this request as a proxy bean.
1468    *
1469    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
1470    * <p class='bjava'>
1471    *    <ja>@RestPost</ja>(<js>"/mypath/{p1}/{p2}/*"</js>)
1472    *    <jk>public void</jk> myMethod(<ja>@Request</ja> MyRequest <jv>requestBean</jv>) {...}
1473    *
1474    *    <jk>public interface</jk> MyRequest {
1475    *
1476    *       <ja>@Path</ja> <jc>// Path variable name inferred from getter.</jc>
1477    *       String getP1();
1478    *
1479    *       <ja>@Path</ja>(<js>"p2"</js>)
1480    *       String getX();
1481    *
1482    *       <ja>@Path</ja>(<js>"/*"</js>)
1483    *       String getRemainder();
1484    *
1485    *       <ja>@Query</ja>
1486    *       String getQ1();
1487    *
1488    *    <jc>// Schema-based query parameter:  Pipe-delimited lists of comma-delimited lists of integers.</jc>
1489    *       <ja>@Query</ja>(
1490    *          collectionFormat=<js>"pipes"</js>
1491    *          items=<ja>@Items</ja>(
1492    *             items=<ja>@SubItems</ja>(
1493    *                collectionFormat=<js>"csv"</js>
1494    *                type=<js>"integer"</js>
1495    *             )
1496    *          )
1497    *       )
1498    *       <jk>int</jk>[][] getQ3();
1499    *
1500    *       <ja>@Header</ja>(<js>"*"</js>)
1501    *       Map&lt;String,Object&gt; getHeaders();
1502    * </p>
1503    *
1504    * @param <T> The request bean interface to instantiate.
1505    * @param c The request bean interface to instantiate.
1506    * @return A new request bean proxy for this REST request.
1507    */
1508   public <T> T getRequest(Class<T> c) {
1509      return getRequest(RequestBeanMeta.create(c, getContext().getAnnotations()));
1510   }
1511
1512   /**
1513    * Same as {@link #getRequest(Class)} but used on pre-instantiated {@link RequestBeanMeta} objects.
1514    *
1515    * @param <T> The request bean interface to instantiate.
1516    * @param rbm The metadata about the request bean interface to create.
1517    * @return A new request bean proxy for this REST request.
1518    */
1519   public <T> T getRequest(final RequestBeanMeta rbm) {
1520      try {
1521         Class<T> c = (Class<T>)rbm.getClassMeta().getInnerClass();
1522         final BeanSession bs = getBeanSession();
1523         final BeanMeta<T> bm = bs.getBeanMeta(c);
1524         return (T)Proxy.newProxyInstance(
1525            c.getClassLoader(),
1526            new Class[] { c },
1527            (InvocationHandler) (proxy, method, args) -> {
1528               RequestBeanPropertyMeta pm = rbm.getProperty(method.getName());
1529               if (pm != null) {
1530                  HttpPartParserSession pp = pm.getParser(getPartParserSession());
1531                  HttpPartSchema schema = pm.getSchema();
1532                  String name = pm.getPartName();
1533                  ClassMeta<?> type = bs.getClassMeta(method.getGenericReturnType());
1534                  HttpPartType pt = pm.getPartType();
1535                  if (pt == HttpPartType.BODY)
1536                     return getContent().setSchema(schema).as(type);
1537                  if (pt == QUERY)
1538                     return getQueryParam(name).parser(pp).schema(schema).as(type).orElse(null);
1539                  if (pt == FORMDATA)
1540                     return getFormParam(name).parser(pp).schema(schema).as(type).orElse(null);
1541                  if (pt == HEADER)
1542                     return getHeaderParam(name).parser(pp).schema(schema).as(type).orElse(null);
1543                  if (pt == PATH)
1544                     return getPathParam(name).parser(pp).schema(schema).as(type).orElse(null);
1545               }
1546               return null;
1547            });
1548      } catch (Exception e) {
1549         throw asRuntimeException(e);
1550      }
1551   }
1552
1553   /* Called by RestSession.finish() */
1554   void close() {
1555      if (config != null) {
1556         config.close();
1557      }
1558   }
1559
1560   /**
1561    * Returns the wrapped servlet request.
1562    *
1563    * @return The wrapped servlet request.
1564    */
1565   public HttpServletRequest getHttpServletRequest() {
1566      return inner;
1567   }
1568
1569   /**
1570    * Returns the part serializer session for this request.
1571    *
1572    * @return The part serializer session for this request.
1573    */
1574   public HttpPartSerializerSession getPartSerializerSession() {
1575      return opContext.getPartSerializer().getPartSession();
1576   }
1577
1578   @Override /* Object */
1579   public String toString() {
1580      StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("\n").append(getRequestLine()).append("\n");
1581      sb.append("---Headers---\n");
1582      getHeaders().forEach(x -> sb.append("\t").append(x).append("\n"));
1583      String m = getMethod();
1584      if (m.equals("PUT") || m.equals("POST")) {
1585         try {
1586            sb.append("---Content UTF-8---\n");
1587            sb.append(content.asString()).append("\n");
1588            sb.append("---Content Hex---\n");
1589            sb.append(content.asSpacedHex()).append("\n");
1590         } catch (Exception e1) {
1591            sb.append(e1.getLocalizedMessage());
1592         }
1593      }
1594      return sb.toString();
1595   }

1597   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1598   // Utility methods
1599   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1600
1601   /*
1602    * Converts an Accept-Language value entry to a Locale.
1603    */
1604   private static Locale toLocale(String lang) {
1605      String country = "";
1606      int i = lang.indexOf('-');
1607      if (i > -1) {
1608         country = lang.substring(i+1).trim();
1609         lang = lang.substring(0,i).trim();
1610      }
1611      return new Locale(lang, country);
1612   }
1613}
